name: Beijing Subway
overview: The Beijing Subway is a rapid transit system serving Beijing, China. It is the world's busiest and one of the longest metro systems, having surpassed Shanghai in total length in 2023. Originally opened in 1969 as China's first subway, it has undergone massive expansion, particularly after Beijing won the 2008 Olympics bid.

history.title: Construction Begins
history.description: Construction begins on China's first subway system, designed primarily for civil defense and government transportation purposes.

history.title: First Line Opens
history.description: The first section opens from Beijing Railway Station to Pingguoyuan. Premier Zhou Enlai boards the first train. Initially restricted to officials only.

history.title: Opens to Public
history.description: After years of restricted operation, the subway fully opens to the general public.

history.title: Line 2 Opens
history.description: Line 2 opens as a loop line following the path of the old Beijing city walls, connecting major railway stations.

history.title: Olympics Bid Won
history.description: Beijing wins the bid to host the 2008 Summer Olympics, triggering massive subway expansion plans.

history.title: Line 13 Opens
history.description: Line 13 opens as a northern suburban commuter line connecting Xizhimen and Dongzhimen.

history.title: Line 5 Opens
history.description: Line 5 opens as the first north-south line through central Beijing, greatly improving network connectivity.

history.title: Olympics Expansion
history.description: Lines 8, 10 (Phase 1), and Capital Airport Express open simultaneously for the 2008 Beijing Olympics.

history.title: Line 4 Opens
history.description: Line 4 opens as the first Beijing MTR-operated line, serving major attractions including the Summer Palace.

history.title: Massive Expansion
history.description: Five lines open in a single day: Lines 15, Changping, Fangshan, Yizhuang, and Daxing, expanding the network by 50%.

history.title: Line 10 Loop Completed
history.description: Line 10 becomes a complete loop, at the time the world's longest single metro loop line at 57 km.

history.title: Automated and Maglev Lines
history.description: Yanfang Line opens as China's first fully automated domestic subway. S1 maglev line also opens.

history.title: Record Ridership
history.description: Beijing Subway sets all-time daily ridership record of 13.75 million passengers.

history.title: Daxing Airport Express
history.description: Daxing Airport Express opens connecting to Beijing's new mega-airport, operating at 160 km/h.

history.title: World's Longest Metro
history.description: Beijing Subway surpasses Shanghai Metro to become the world's longest metro system by route length.

history.title: Lines 3 and 12 Open
history.description: Lines 3 and 12 open along with the Changping Line southern extension, bringing the network to 879 km.

history.title: Line 18 Opens
history.description: Line 18 opens along with Line 17's central section and Line 6's southern extension, bringing the network to 887.5 km.
